bow: tantrum central literally dread going food shopping with my year old it like walking into war zone without knowing the outcome of things 10 times am the one who ends up walking out of the shop with screaming child in my arms and find it so embarrassing childless people staring at you like wow how can she give in to him like that end up feeling so judged when things go wrong in the supermarket such as when eddie is having complete meltdown over silly things and when finally get to go shopping on my own which is rare it like godsend end up looking at other mums with more kids than myself thinking how does she manage dont worry about judgement take care of your child make him aware that when is not behaving properly that there are many other children that can seen acting proper let him know it hers your feelings the store go to gives free cookie at the bakery both of my kids know they have to be good to get cookie at the bakery would say of the time they do get cookie amp x200b good luck amp x200b my mom used to do this with us kids it helped her lot threw tantrum once and still remember it it was the only tantrum ever threw in public place my mom grabbed my arm not to hurt me or anything but strong enough that knew she was in charge and she told me you keep doing that swear you will wait in the car but what heard was dont give damn about other people they will not protect you from being disciplined if you dont behave you are not in charge no matter where we are and how many people there is will scold you swear felt shame for the first time ever she won she didnt give damn about the other people watching us and felt it just could never win with her because she didnt give damn what other people thought she wouldnt leave the store ashamed she would discipline me right now right there in front of everyone better to behave than to be disciplined in front of everyone swear removed agree with letting him know that it hurts your feelings when he behaves that way learned to tell my step daughter your behavior is hurting my feelings know you can behave better he still really young but he ll start understanding that when behave badly it makes you got this do mind all the bad stares people are jerks ll let you know there probably more people in that store that probably understand removed wish my store had something like this though feel with your example that would be for the child to wait in the car know it hard but try not to worry about judgement people without kids have no idea people with kids know your struggles toddlers have such big big feelings and it hard for them to not get over stimulated at grocery store your kiddo won do that forever one day they ll not even want to come grocery shopping lol stay strong mama you got this oh wow find it sooooo hard to do this like in public mean he generally good kid but can be pain must admit obviously every kid is different but literally when eddie throws tantrum in public or whatever he lays on the ground kicks and screams and it sooooo frustrating for me to handle this haha to be honest can wait for that day might sound harsh there is great book would like to recommend how to talk so little kids listen it literally changed my relationship with my twins almost overnight lol totally understandable twos are so hard used to keep some small candy like amp ms or dumdums and just bribe the heck out of them probably not the greatest strategy but had four and my sanity demanded it he and tantrums are age appropriate they all throw themselves on the floor not just your kid it ok as mom of can say that it good to have plan only go to the store if he well rested like after nap time you can also bring healthy snack or some stores have fruit for kids if he having tantrum you can either ignore it and wait him out or hurry up and get what you have to do done sometimes you have to abort the mission leave the cart of groceries and leave rest assured that your child will outgrow the tantrums and that they are not reflection on you as parent he toddler he not going to listen like an adult or even like an older child know it hard but remember that he still very little do you have help with him at home might have look into this as have just managed to start reading again before bed before just used to go straight to bed and that was me for the day because was so knackered could find this book on amazon maybe sure you could in australia and simply bought the audio book on google play so listened to it on my phone it was little expensive 22 but worth every cent yeah guess well to be fair do feel like single parent at times as my partner works gruelling 12 hour shifts his dad does help out don get me wrong and really appreciate that though eddie is such mamas boy and sometimes it literally kills me he has begun to draw more to this dad now though which am very thankful for haha but other than that he does go to his grandparents most days as at work and obviously with his grandparents he an angel 99 of the time he not really good talker either for his age as my health visitor has pointed out he does understand what tell him though he seems to struggle to get his words right at times and it makes me feel so sad at times like as if haven taught him enough or have done anything wrong for him to not understand is just hard my twins will be in may is there any way you can minimize the amount of times you have to take him grocery shopping or find time that works better in his schedule almost never grocery shop with my toddlers because it just not worth it that being said don feel ashamed or embarrassed we ve all been there and you re doing your best to raise an emotional tiny human oh yeah that it keep forgetting about those audio book thingys might have look into this thank you mine doesn however my 5yo and 5yo twins love donuts so they know that if they are good when we we are done the bakery in the store is out last stop and they can get donut or if we are at costco they get churro to share also witnessed and stole the idea of carrying dumdum pops in my purse diaper bag so if it store that doesn have bakery if they are good they get pop not every time and every store but on those days they are struggling will remind them that they get treat at the end if they are good helpers when we shop toddlers are rough so not above bribery rewards audio books are amazing listen to them in the car on the way to and from work while cleaning and gardening even if had time to read ve had trouble focusing on it since had kids omg twins honestly praise you for having twins well praise all those mamas who has twins have always wondered whether eddie would benefit of having another sibling to play with don know but then think bloody hell am never having kids ever again after all the tantrums he been having lately ve always wanted to ask someone with twins whether they feel like it easy have been doing some grocery shopping online lately find it pretty good as don need to deal with grumpy toddler but then it like always miss to get something so have to end up going shopping anyways occasionally do ask the in laws to look after the grumpster while go shopping but then feel guilty for leaving him with them though he like star when he being looked after by his grandparents honestly have never experienced anything like it since become mom the guilt yeah that good way to get cas or the police called for child locked alone in car it sounds like you re under lot of stress the fact that your son has trouble expressing himself may be part of why he has tantrums he frustrated and it not your fault you sound like good attentive mother who is exhausted for little while could you ask family member to watch him while you go shopping and could your son be evaluated by speech therapist if your health visitor is pointing out that he not talking much speech evaluation is usually the next step it sounds like your son prefers to stay at his grandparents rather than go shopping detest shopping even as an adult so understand you re giving him great gift by letting him visit while you run errands honestly am amazed at those with twins am always wondering how do you do it how do you even manage do have some things try and bribe him with but it almost impossible at most times haha don go if my son is hungry or tired if have big trip will get him new toy at the dollar tree before to play with big trips for me involve lots of bulk bin shopping amp weighing amp tracking the price of everything so it can take while also baby wear him if needed struggle the most with getting all the groceries in our 2nd floor apartment this is when always baby wear him on my back and then getting everything unloaded it such long time for him in the end now that he he gets to pick out his own fruit amp veg to try so its little more exciting for him it gets better—hang in there can you get your kid involved with helping you choose and fetch things the grocery store can be great place to practice colors numbers and recognition of familiar items have them choose red or green pears grapes it oranges fresh veg for dinner maybe which pack of cookies or ice cream to bring home kids often like to grab things for you for the cart push and be involved more than being trapped in the little seat the entire time when their attention is fading pop them back in with snack while you finish up would highly recommend book called naptastrophy it is about bunny having temper tantrum at the grocery store my advice is to reward good behavior my two year old always gets something special at the end of shopping trip this could be picking out healthy treat small art supply bagel for lunch when we get home ect since you kind of have negative routine going no offense start with the highest reward you can think of tell him exactly what you want him to do sit quietly and hold toy and what you are going to buy then do it as fast as humanly possible also explain that temper tantrum means you leave with nothing make sure he knows what will happen if he is well behaved and what will happen if he has temper tantrum your reaction is everything you have to be estatic about good behavior and numb to poor behavior once you get good routine going you can go shopping for longer and give smaller rewards good luck now you re saying it do feel under lot of pressure and stress at times and it not those big things that sets this off it like me having to do everything such as cleaning cooking shopping making sure everything ironed and more it driving me nuts at times yeah she did point it out when she was here about weeks ago she put me on the list to be referred to speech therapist though it months waiting list to even see someone and that stresses me the hell out because it feels like can help him enough mind his grandparents are big help but it like that guilt you know asking them to have him and whatnot it just makes me feel bad as supposed to be his mom haha it this never ending feeling of guilt and it annoying just feel like not enough at times agreed this is what works for my toddler now the grocery store is one of her favourite places removed we all have our good and our bad days sometimes my child 2yo behaves perfectly in the store and then there was that one day when he threw an entire carton of eggs in the cart basket and there were raw eggs everywhere you are enough and you re doing great job take care of your mental health know that seems really hard right now but you said that you now have some time to read after your son goes to bed also ask your partner for help yes he works but so do you also let the grandparents help and try to see it as gift to both your son and his grandparents that they have relationship there is no shame in getting your child the evaluations health care that he needs please stay on that wait list and see how it goes take breath if things are really bad please see your doctor it helps that ve given up on worrying what other people think when they do throw tantrums because just don have the emotional energy to care what they think at this point other than that consistency and routine we go out all the time so they know what expect and have left full shopping carts to lug them to the car when one couldn stop tantrum at times but mainly bribery they are also the type that like to be my helpers so they have little notepads and crayons we bring with their list so they check things off and put them in the cart as we shop and even though they like to think they are big enough to walk they stay in the cart since outnumbered he used to be really good at this until he turned noticed massive change in him straight away everything got so much more difficult to even keep him still he literally runs all over the place and doesn want to sit still which is understandable in his age but now he not even interested in anything like used to be mind must say sometimes he is good but not often enough if that makes sense haha that why love online grocery shopping it is so hard have three boys and it just hard we both work graveyards so am also usually on my own to grocery shop when had my last one it just simply became too much so now utilize grocery pickup and it saves my sanity not sure if you have that option but also it is absolutely ok to leave him with his grandparents so it better for you both know it hard mama hang in there and as far as judgment goes as hard as it is ignore them because either they and its gold once heard something that changed the way look at every tantrum every new negative experience is the worst thing that has ever happened to them those poor little souls they have to work usually subsided quickly also often bring snacks something special would give at home and use them as rewards for appropriate behaviour public tantrums are fun when your because they embarrass you and
